greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the generalized Glaisher-Kinkelin constant A(20).
comment: Also known as the 20th Bendersky constant.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = -58..2000
formula: A(k) = exp(H(k)*B(k+1)/(k+1) - zeta'(-k)), where B(k) is the k-th Bernoulli number, H(k) the k-th harmonic number, and zeta'(x) is the derivative of the Riemann Zeta function.
A(20) = exp(-20! * Zeta(21) / (2^21 * Pi^20)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 01 2016
results.author: _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 31 2015
